Part 1

  • Create a HTTP2 server and client
  • GET, POST, PUT
  • upload image
  • get json
  • receive notification with server push

part 2

select 2 of 4 features: flow control, stream priority, multiplexing, and server push. analyze its:

  • the day of data transmissions
  • amount of traffic
  • throughput
  • latency

Use wireshark and other tools needed. Repeat the experiment > 3 times. Instructions of how to compare in the experiment:

  • HTTP1.1 vs HTTP2 or
  • HTTP2 with features enabled/disabled (for example, disabling/enabling multiplexing)

Notes

https://jimshaver.net/2015/02/11/decrypting-tls-browser-traffic-with-wireshark-the-easy-way/ how to get the sslkeylog export SSLKEYLOGFILE=$HOME/sslkeylog.log then open firefox/google-chrome from the same terminal
